result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J. KREJCAREK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Richard and Irene Thiry, their residence or any place they occupy.

Have no contact with Gary Wagner, his residence, his vehicles or any place he occupies.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.  
Court authorizes travel outside Manitowoc County for employment purposes or transfer to another county jail.

Spend an additional four (4) months in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-05-16 at 11:00 a.m
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.
RE:  Gary Wagner, on 01-02-16.
Amending the no contact condition.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony theft and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Gary Wagner or his residence at 1603 East Street, Two Rivers, WI and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs. Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence.
Minutes.
